title: Bar Closure: Liquidating High Value Bottles and Back Bar Collectibles
metaTitle: Bar Closure: Selling High Value Bottles and Back Bar Collectibles | Proof Cellars
metaDescription: How to sell high value spirits and collectible bottles when closing a bar. Covers rare spirits, back bar collectibles, opened bottle policies, and getting fair value.
summary: Bars often accumulate rare and collectible spirits over years of operation. When closing, these bottles can represent significant value if handled properly.

sections.heading: What to Do Next
content: Identify your high value bottles first. These are typically allocated bourbons, rare scotches, vintage spirits, and collectible bottles that sit on the back bar.
Separate sealed bottles from opened ones. We buy sealed bottles only.
list: Identify allocated and collectible bottles
Separate sealed from opened inventory
Photograph each valuable bottle clearly
Note any original packaging, boxes, or tubes
Create a list with bottle names and sizes
Submit photos and list for an offer

sections.heading: What Information Matters for Pricing
content: We focus on collectible and rare bottles. Common mixing spirits typically do not have resale value, but rare bottles can be worth significant amounts.
list: Producer names (distillery or bottler)
Age statements or batch numbers if visible
Bottle sizes
Fill level for each bottle
Original packaging (boxes, tubes, cases)
Storage conditions (back bar display versus cellar storage)

sections.heading: Common Mistakes to Avoid
content: Opened bottles are not eligible for purchase, regardless of how full they appear. Only sealed bottles have resale value.
Do not assume back bar display bottles are worthless. Some display bottles are sealed and valuable.
list: Including opened bottles in submissions
Assuming all display bottles are opened
Discarding original boxes or tubes
Not checking back stock for sealed duplicates
Selling to the first buyer without checking value

sections.heading: How the Process Works
content: We focus on collectible spirits. Send photos of your valuable bottles and we will identify what has resale value.
list: Text photos to 213-770-9463 or submit through our form
We identify which bottles have value and provide an offer
If accepted, we coordinate pickup
Payment is issued after we receive and verify the bottles

sections.heading: Privacy and Safety Notes
content: We handle bar closures discreetly. Your sale is not publicized.
We provide receipts and documentation suitable for business records.
We can coordinate pickup at times that work for your closure schedule.

faqs.question: Do you buy opened bottles?
faqs.answer: No. Only sealed bottles can be resold. Opened bottles, even if nearly full, are not eligible.

faqs.question: How do I know which bottles are valuable?
faqs.answer: Send photos of your rare and allocated bottles. We identify what has value. Look for limited editions, allocated bourbons, single malts with age statements, and vintage or discontinued items.

faqs.question: What about bottles on the back bar for years?
faqs.answer: Display does not hurt value if bottles are sealed and in good condition. Check that bottles are actually sealed and note any fill level or capsule issues.

faqs.question: Do you buy regular mixing spirits?
faqs.answer: We focus on collectible and rare bottles. Standard mixing spirits typically do not have resale value above wholesale.

faqs.question: Can you help identify sealed versus opened bottles?
faqs.answer: Check for intact capsules, unbroken wax seals, or intact tax stamps depending on the bottle type. If unsure, send photos and we can often tell from images.

faqs.question: What if I only have a few valuable bottles?
faqs.answer: We buy single bottles or small lots. Even a few valuable bottles can be worth significant amounts.
